question_stem:
Q4. Consider model M3. From the output of summary(M3), if we let p = prob(Churned = 1), and p-hat be the estimation of p, then we could write the fitted equation of model M3 as
Log(p-hat) = 3.503 – 0.157*Age + 0.382*Churned_contacts
Log [ p-hat/(1-p-hat)] = 3.503 – 0.157*Age + 0.382*Churned_contacts
p-hat = 3.503 – 0.157*Age + 0.382*Churned_contacts
p = 3.503 – 0.157*Age + 0.382*Churned_contacts
p-hat / (1 – p-hat) = 3.503 – 0.157*Age + 0.382*Churned_contacts
question_stem_html:
Q4. Consider model M3. From the output of summary(M3), if we let p = prob(Churned = 1), and p-hat be the estimation of p, then we could write the fitted equation of model M3 as
Log(p-hat) = 3.503 – 0.157*Age + 0.382*Churned_contacts
Log [ p-hat/(1-p-hat)] = 3.503 – 0.157*Age + 0.382*Churned_contacts
p-hat = 3.503 – 0.157*Age + 0.382*Churned_contacts
p = 3.503 – 0.157*Age + 0.382*Churned_contacts
p-hat / (1 – p-hat) = 3.503 – 0.157*Age + 0.382*Churned_contacts
